title: Disinfection
description: Ozonation provides deep disinfection of premises and transport, destroying bacteria, viruses, fungi and spores without chemical residues. The gas penetrates all hard-to-reach areas.

offices.title: Office premises
offices.content:
The office is the face of the company. Polluted air with unpleasant odors harms staff, reduces productivity and loyalty, and damages the company's image with clients and partners.

In most buildings, concentrations of toxic substances in the air are 2–5 times higher than outdoors. Benzene, formaldehyde and ammonia are released from furniture, carpets, office equipment and finishes. Ozonation effectively neutralizes these pollutants.

Ozone disinfects everything staff and visitors touch: desktops, armrests, office equipment, coffee machines. It reduces virus transmission via surfaces, removes odors and freshens the air.

Treatment is run at night on a timer. 1–2 hours of ozonation is usually enough. Ozone generator capacity: about 1 g/h per 25 m³ of room volume. By the time staff arrive, ozone has dissipated, leaving a light fresh smell.
benefits: Removal of toxic substances from air

public-transport.title: Public transport
public-transport.shortDesc: Disinfection of buses, trams and trolleybuses
public-transport.content:
Public transport is a high-risk environment for infection transmission. Ozonation allows quick and effective disinfection of bus, tram and trolleybus interiors between runs or at night.

Ozone disinfects everything passengers touch: handrails, seats, windows and walls. The gas penetrates all crevices and hard-to-reach areas for full interior treatment. Odors and mold growth are also suppressed.

Treatment: 20–40 minutes depending on interior volume. After treatment, ventilate for 20 minutes or use the vehicle's ventilation system to clear ozone.

Equipment can run from the vehicle's power (12V or 24V). No staff need to stay — turn on the generator and leave. No consumables reduce operating costs.

sports-facilities.title: Sports facilities
sports-facilities.shortDesc: Disinfection of halls and locker rooms
sports-facilities.content:
Gyms, fitness centers and locker rooms are high-risk for infection spread and have specific odors. Ozonation addresses both: it disinfects equipment and removes sweat odor.

Ozone destroys bacteria, viruses, mold, fungi and parasitic protozoa on equipment, stands, benches and mats. The gas penetrates material pores for deep disinfection.

Sports facilities are treated at night. 2–3 hours at about 1 g/h per 25 m³ is typical. For large halls and arenas, mobile ozone generators of 60–120 g/h are used.

After the generator is off, ozone drops to safe levels in 2–3 hours. Only a light fresh smell remains. Staff should not enter during treatment.

shopping-malls.title: Shopping malls
shopping-malls.content:
Shopping malls are high-traffic spaces with dense visitor flow. Ozonation maintains air quality, removes odors and helps prevent infection spread.

Regular ozone treatment during off-hours disinfects all surfaces: escalators, handrails, elevators, benches, restrooms. The gas reaches all areas, including back-of-house and technical zones.

Ozone effectively removes odors from food courts, restrooms and storage areas. It neutralizes chemical pollutants from finishes and merchandise. The air becomes fresh and pleasant for visitors.

Large malls use high-capacity industrial ozone generators or systems integrated with ventilation. Treatment is automated with timers and sensors.
